techmeme.title: Meta says US users over 18 can now sign up to be a Community Notes contributor on Facebook, Instagram, and Threads; notes will have a 500-character limit (Ian Carlos Campbell/Engadget)
Amazon plans to end support for its videoconferencing tool Chime on February 20, 2026; report: Amazon is adopting Zoom as its standard app for internal meetings (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
FTC Chair Andrew Ferguson announces an inquiry into "Big Tech censorship", which he says is "un-American" and "potentially illegal" (Emily Birnbaum/Bloomberg)
Amazon surpassed Walmart in quarterly sales for the first time during the most recent quarter, with a revenue of $187.8B compared to Walmart's $180.5B (Annie Palmer/CNBC)
YouTube plans a premium lite tier in the US, Australia, Germany, and Thailand, offering podcasts and how-to clips without ads; music videos will have ads (Ashley Carman/Bloomberg)
